author: Carlos Cid

text:
Memories are being made.
It's time to go down this road that's paved.
Our friends want to play some more.
Let's play Mario Kart 64.

Everyday we're having the greatest time.
The best time of our lives.
I wish the day would never end.
This will last forever, my friend.

Now we've got to move on.
The fun won't last very long.
Those days are behind us now.
Please, please do not pout and frown.

Remember all the good times we've shared.
Even though life may not seem very fair.
These moments will remain in our hearts.
As we drive around in our little karts.

Never... Forget... The memories...

text:
out of all these staff themes ive heard for mario kart the n64 version is still the best by far!
i get a different feeling from this one then any of the other themes 
(no not just nostalgia)  almost like the game is happy you beat it and now this song is your reward for beating it.   same goes for sm64 too.

text:
I would have to disagree, many games are FPS's and such, but many are still focusing on story, take Phoenix Wright by Capcom, brilliant story and music, many DS games nowadays like Ghost Trick focus little on guns and such, many games and companies still have their touch.

Incidentally if you didn't know, Capcom are making Miles Edgeworth Ace Prosecutor 2.

author: SupraDarky

text: @TheRandomDragon01 It's not all people who think that way. Many others feel the same way as you, myself included. Personally, I hate Halo and Modern Warfare. I'd rather avoid the online gaming world of angry, homophobic teenagers. I disagree with you that games are getting worse and worse, though; Sure, the SNES and N64 eras were the golden age of gaming, but the Wii has some phenomenal games on it. Super Mario Galaxy, anyone?
author: PaperMario15

text: @TheRandomDragon01  I agree, my friends also do not care for their old games. They even sell them to game stop to buy newer games for their xbox 360. Even though people do not care for the wii anymore, I still do and I know nintendo is going to be king of video games again.

text: Another excellent song added to the list! This song heralded the credit theme songs of the other Mario Karts, each of which are equally good, but this one is the best, and shall be remembered as such.
author: TheSeer

text: @CloudStrifeEX  Yeah I know, this sure brings back memories when almost anyone who had this game watched and played the amazement of the gameplay in Mario Kart 64. Now all games we have played are really the most cherished moments in our video game lives. We all know how fun it was to play these games. Now it is the future and more games have improved their quality. In other words, time passes by.
author: MarioMan181

text:
Excellent choice. I have a lot of affection in Super Mario 64's Staff Roll. This one is quite epic, too. Just as I'd expect.

I feel it is fairly rare to find a game that makes you feel good that you beat it, when you get to hear the staff roll music. That is not a good thing. But it makes me cherish the ones I know!

text:
@SupraDarky haha I know I'm just messing with ya man. The list would be kind of boring if all of the "greatest songs ever" were within the first 20.
and it seems to be working for ya, as you've almost breached 700! congrats!
author: Nathan McMonigle

text: @64person  I've already explained this previously but since people keep saying this when I post very popular VGMs, I'll explain again. You guys have to understand that I'm purposely holding off on those songs because I want to space them out throughout the list. So a song like this one making the list at #693 is actually something I try to achieve. It keeps everything more interesting. I'm pretty sure even Super Mario Bros' main theme hasn't been added yet. ;)
